history.content:
Hello!

Thanks for your question - the follow up to this is whether or not it's alright with the instructors. EECS and EE courses historically do not allow time conflicts - but it will depend on whether or not the instructor approves you having a time conflict with the course. Typically final exams follow the same pattern if they have a the same time slot for during the week. So you would need to see if there was an option for an alternative final. 

Long and short is - is it possible? Yes. But it's going to require doing some conversations with the instructors to get their permission, and it's possible they may not feel it's a good idea if your missing extensive lecture etc. But, it never hurts to ask.  If you receive permission, please contact EE Scheduling and we can work with you. 

Cheers, 

Kait

I am interested in taking both EE122 and EE127 for next semester Spring 2022. Unfortunately, both classes are happening at the same time (TTh 2:00pm - 3:29pm). Is it possible to take both classes and allow cross-conflicts? I am currently enrolled in EE122 where the final exam is scheduled for Monday 5/9 11:30am - 2:30pm, and I'm not sure when the EE127 final exam is scheduled to occur. I just wanted to know if this was possible as I am really interested in adding EE127 to my current schedule.
history.subject: Possible to take both EE122 and EE127? (Lecture Time Conflict for Spring2022)
